      • returnTokenPositions

        public void returnTokenPositions()
        Switches to the mode in which token positions (instead of character positions) are returned in the output structures.

      • returnCharacterPositions

        public void returnCharacterPositions()
        Switches to the mode in which character positions (instead of token positions) are returned in the output structures.

      • producesTokenPositions

        public boolean producesTokenPositions()
        For checking the type of returned start/end position information.
        Returns:
        true if the flat pattern matcher returns token positions, or false otherwise.

      • caseInsensitiveModeActive

        public void caseInsensitiveModeActive()
        Switches to the case-insensitive mode, i.e., the input text is downcased before processing, but not the pattern matcher entries.

      • caseSensitiveModeActive

        public void caseSensitiveModeActive()
        Switches to the case-sensitive mode.

      • isCaseSensitive

        public boolean isCaseSensitive()
        For checking if the case-sensitive mode is on
        Returns:
        true if the flat pattern matcher is case-sensitive or false otherwise.

      • findMatch

        public java.util.ArrayList<AbstractDisjunctionOfFlatPatternMatcherItems> findMatch(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTokenItem> tokens,
                                                                                   java.lang.String inputText,
                                                                                   TokenTagger tagger)
        Applies the flat pattern matcher to a given input text, and returns an array list of disjunctions of flat pattern matcher items, where each such disjunction represents a match (possibly with more than one reading) in the input text at a given position. By default start/end token positions are returned, and the flat pattern matcher works in the case-sensitive modus.
        Parameters:
        tokens - an array list of tokens (See also AbstractTokenItem )
        inputText - string representing the input text
        tagger - token tagger that will be applied to assign tokens some semantic classes
        Returns:
        an array list of disjunctions of flat pattern matcher items.

      • findMatch

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<AbstractDisjunctionOfFlatPatternMatcherItems> findMatch(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTokenItem> tokens,
                                                                                            char[] inputText,
                                                                                            TokenTagger tagger)
        Applies the flat pattern matcher to a given input text, and returns an array list of disjunctions of flat pattern matcher items, where each such disjunction represents a match (possibly with more than one reading) in the input text at a given position. By default start/end token positions are returned, and the flat pattern matcher works in the case-sensitive modus.
        Parameters:
        tokens - an array list of tokens (See also AbstractTokenItem )
        inputText - character array with the input text
        tagger - token tagger that will be applied to assign tokens some semantic classes
        Returns:
        an array list of disjunctions of flat pattern matcher items.

      • createInstance

        public static AbstractFlatPatternMatcher createInstance(java.lang.String type)
        Factory method for obtaining flat pattern matcher instances (Currently one implementation is available)
        Parameters:
        type - string which specifies which implementation of flat pattern matcher is chosen.

        Following types are available:

        • basicFlatPatternMatcher

        Returns:
        a handle to a dynamically created flat pattern matcher
